content.question: The figure shows an electron <math alttext="e" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> that is at the center of a square configuration of fixed particles. Each particle has a charge of magnitude <math alttext="q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and sign as shown. Which of the following is a correct force diagram for the electron?

choices.label: The figure presents force diagram with four equally spaced arrows that are pointing diagonally outward from the center electron.
The figure presents a force diagram with four equally spaced arrows that are diagonally pointing inward, toward the center electron.

The figure presents a force diagram with four arrows that are pointing outward from the center electron. Two of the arrows point diagonally upward and to the left, and two of the arrows point diagonally upward and to the right.

The figure presents a force diagram with four arrows that are pointing outward from the center electron. Two of the arrows point diagonally downward and to the left, and two of the arrows point diagonally downward and to the right.

content.answer: The figure presents a force diagram with four arrows that are pointing outward from the center electron. Two of the arrows point diagonally upward and to the left, and two of the arrows point diagonally upward and to the right.
